perturbation.original_text:
Supplier Name:

Cardlytics, Inc.
 Agreement Number:
 CW251207
Supplier Address:

621 North Avenue NE
Suite C-30
Atlanta, GA 30308
perturbation.changed_text:
Supplier Name:

Cardlytics, Inc.
 Agreement Number:
 CW251207
Supplier Address:

Best efforts will be used to maintain accurate contact information, including:
621 North Avenue NE
Suite C-30
Atlanta, GA 30308
perturbation.explanation: Replacing the definite address with 'Best efforts will be used to maintain accurate contact information' introduces ambiguity. This makes it difficult to serve legal notices or enforce contractual obligations dependent on the supplier's physical location. While the address is included, the 'best efforts' clause weakens the commitment to maintaining that specific address. The contract is based in Georgia, and under Georgia law, proper notification is vital for contract enforcement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Georgia law regarding contract enforcement and notification

perturbation.original_text:
This Schedule (“Schedule”) is made as of the effective date set forth above to that Software License, Customization, and Maintenance Agreement,
by and between Cardlytics, Inc. (“Supplier”) and Bank of America, N. A, (“Bank of America”), dated November 5, 2010, as amended (“SLCMA”).
Each capitalized term used but not defined herein shall have the meaning assigned in the SLCMA.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Schedule (“Schedule”) is made as of the effective date set forth above to that Software License, Customization, and Maintenance Agreement,
by and between Cardlytics, Inc. (“Supplier”) and Bank of America, N. A, (“Bank of America”), dated November 5, 2010, as amended (“SLCMA”).
Each capitalized term used but not defined herein shall generally have the meaning assigned in the SLCMA.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall have the meaning' to 'shall generally have the meaning' introduces ambiguity regarding the definitions of capitalized terms. This allows for potential disputes over interpretation and undermines the clear, consistent definitions intended by referencing the SLCMA. This could impede clear contract enforcement under Georgia law, which stresses the significance of clear contractual language.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Georgia law regarding contract interpretation and definiteness of terms.

perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, Bank of America and Supplier entered into the SLCMA in order to set forth the terms and conditions pursuant to which Supplier
provides certain Software to Bank of America,
WHEREAS, the parties desire to add to the SLCMA the Supplier Offer Placement System Software;
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, Bank of America and Supplier entered into the SLCMA with the intent to allow the Supplier to provide Software to Bank of America,
WHEREAS, the parties may desire to add to the SLCMA the Supplier Offer Placement System Software;
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'in order to set forth the terms and conditions' to 'with the intent to allow' weakens the binding nature of the original agreement. Also, 'desire to add' has been changed to 'may desire to add', which introduces ambiguity, making it uncertain whether the Offer Placement System Software will actually be included. This weakens the obligation for the supplier to provide it and can lead to issues with fulfillment and Georgia contract laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Georgia contract law regarding the binding nature of agreements and specific performance.
